title: Add flag --danglingParentheses

comments.body:
Config style is triggered only when there is a newline after the opening `(` and before closing `)`. In


```scala
html(fooooooooooooooooooooooo, barrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrr

                )
```
there is no newline between `(` and `fooooooooo....`. In 

```scala
function(
  longerArg1,
  longerArg2,
  longerArg3)
```
there is no newline between `longerArg3` and `)`.

I'm all open for suggestions on making config style work more intuitive. The thing is scalafmt takes liberty to put a newline after the opening `(` depending on the column width budget. However, you have full control over when config styleÂ is triggered by choosing to use a dangling parenthesis or not.
In combination with #241 (once implemented), you should be able to get the expected output.

body:
Original:
```scala
function(
  longerArg1,
  longerArg2,
  longerArg3)
```

Scalafmt:
```scala
function(
  longerArg1,
  longerArg2,
  longerArg3)
```

I would like the input to look like this:
```scala
function(
  longerArg1,
  longerArg2,
  longerArg3
)
```

Using:
* 0.2.5

```scala
style = ScalafmtStyle.default.copy(
  maxColumn = 10,
  continuationIndentCallSite = 2,
  continuationIndentDefnSite = 2,
  configStyleArguments = true
)
```

Oddly enough it seems to do what I want in some cases:

```scala
haoyi-Ammonite@ org.scalafmt.Scalafmt.format(
                       """html(
                  head(
                    script(src:="..."),
                    script(
                      "alert('Hello World')"
                    )
                  ),
                  body(
                    div(
                      h1(id:="title", "This is a title"),
                      p("This is a big paragraph of text")
                    )
                  )
                )""".replace(" ", ""),
                       style = ScalafmtStyle.default.copy(
                         maxColumn = 50,
                         continuationIndentCallSite = 2,
                         continuationIndentDefnSite = 2,
                         configStyleArguments = true
                       ),
                       runner = ScalafmtRunner.statement
                     ).get
res11: String = """
html(
  head(
    script(src := "..."),
    script(
      "alert('HelloWorld')"
    )
  ),
  body(
    div(
      h1(id := "title", "Thisisatitle"),
      p("Thisisabigparagraphoftext")
    )
  )
)

"""
```

But not others:

```scala
haoyi-Ammonite@ org.scalafmt.Scalafmt.format(
                       """html(fooooooooooooooooooooooo, barrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrr

                )""".replace(" ", ""),
                       style = ScalafmtStyle.default.copy(
                         maxColumn = 50,
                         continuationIndentCallSite = 2,
                         continuationIndentDefnSite = 2,
                         configStyleArguments = true
                       ),
                       runner = ScalafmtRunner.statement
                     ).get
res12: String = """
html(fooooooooooooooooooooooo,
     barrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrr)

"""
```

Given `configStyleArguments = true`, I want any multi-line parens to *always* have the closing paren on a new-line, java-curly-style, as opposed to having it tacked on the end of an existing line list-style
